Posted By: dberry02 (10/26/2010 5:06:25 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It is true, this card is very expensive. Take for example a card with the same effect, [Essence Drain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Essence Drain) (one black mana, and 4 cololess). Same effect but 1 colorless cheaper, and only requires 1 black mana. Usually that is how it works with flashbacks though, they add a little to the mana cost.  
  
My point is however, this card is not "worthless", rather it is synergetic. I have this card in a flashback deck, and i can cast it on you..say... 40 times? I only have one but because of it's flashback ability it has advantages other cards don't. Combine it with 3 or 4 [catalyst stone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=catalyst stone)s and you are looking at 2 to 3 mana 6 life swing.  
  
When rating cards it is important to understand that almost every card has it's place in magic, and it's spot to shine.
posts.html:

My point is however, this card is not "worthless", rather it is synergetic. I have this card in a flashback deck, and i can cast it on you..say... 40 times? I only have one but because of it's flashback ability it has advantages other cards don't. Combine it with 3 or 4 catalyst stones and you are looking at 2 to 3 mana 6 life swing.

When rating cards it is important to understand that almost every card has it's place in magic, and it's spot to shine.

Posted By: Sheph (10/20/2009 9:10:16 AM)

posts.post_content: Increadibly powerful in Limited. *M:tG* R&D member and former Pro Tour player Zac Hill has stated that this is "probably the best or second-best black common in *Odyssey* Limited. Neutralizing two of your opponent's threats with a single card is just that good."
posts.html:
Increadibly powerful in Limited. M:tG R&D member and former Pro Tour player Zac Hill has stated that this is "probably the best or second-best black common in Odyssey Limited. Neutralizing two of your opponent's threats with a single card is just that good."

Posted By: A3Kitsune (12/16/2011 1:45:36 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Here's the article that A3Kitsune mentioned: http://www.wizards.com/magic/magazine/article.aspx?x=mtg/daily/ld/173  
  
Unfortunately, "good in limited" is too often a euphemism for "terrible unless the only alternatives are worse." Saying something is better than [Filthy Cur](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Filthy Cur), [Zombie Assassin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zombie Assassin), and [Patriarch's Desire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Patriarch's Desire) is not exactly a testament to the card's power.
posts.html:
Here's the article that A3Kitsune mentioned: http://www.wizards.com/magic/magazine/article.aspx?x=mtg/daily/ld/173

Unfortunately, "good in limited" is too often a euphemism for "terrible unless the only alternatives are worse." Saying something is better than Filthy Cur, Zombie Assassin, and Patriarch's Desire is not exactly a testament to the card's power.
